result.execSummary:
The defendant George L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, George L Brown was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George L Brown is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • George L Brown was found guilty of 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$518  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any of KM's family.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Supplemental brief in support of motion for postconviction relief (def's)

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Thomas Brady Aquino.  Mary Ellen Karst and Erin Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's proposal engage in evidentiary hearing, then set a briefing schedule for issues that are raised.  Castle doctrine is preserved for appeal purposes.  Atty. Aquino calls David Sapterstein, sworn.  Direct exam.  Cross exam by DDA Karst.  Court starts to have collequy with defendant on client/attorney privilege/paused.  Atty. Aquino states this has already been waived due to Machner hearing.  Court does not need to have collequy with defendant, after case law awas reviced and discussed.  Cross exam continues by DDA Karst.  Re-direct by Atty. Aquino.  Witness excused.  Defense is to have his supplemental brief in by 12/9/16.  State has until 1/9/17 to address all issues raised.  Defense reply to States response due 1/23/2017.  Court is asking for at least 60 days for decision oral or written.  Court will set date.

Reporter: Melanie Nelson
Ct reviews jury inst w/counsel.  Jurors present 8:30.  Ct gives jury instructions.  Closings by ADA Throckmorton, Atty Saperstein, ADA Karst.  Alternate juror chosen.  Ct gives final instructions. Bailiff sworn.  
Jurors present w/verdict 2:33.  Ct 1 not guilty, ct 2 guilty - w/dangerous weapon.  Ct polls the jury.  
State requests judgment on the verdict.  Ct 1 will be dismissed.  State requests bail revoked.  Ct revokes bail and orders PSI.
